args.new_name: Plant Structures as Caterpillar Environmental Context

args.new_description: Plant structures (such as leaves and stems) used by caterpillars and butterflies as physical substrates for egg-laying, feeding, and chrysalis attachment.

Entity 'stem' is described as an attachment point for the chrysalis, matching the substrate/habitat role of 'Plant Structures as Caterpillar Substrate' rather than the camouflage-focused context of the original class.

Refining the class_type_hint to 'Feeding Behavior' keeps this behavioral class distinct from habitat/structure and defense classes while correctly situating it within caterpillar–plant interaction behaviors.

args.name: Ecological Predators

args.justification: Within 'Ecological Interactions', the entity 'predators' is an organism role rather than an interaction or process concept, warranting its own focused class.
Move 'predators' from a mixed interaction/process class into a new class dedicated to predator organisms and roles, improving conceptual coherence.
Assign a shared Class_Group capturing broad ecological system-level concepts for consistency with other ecology-related classes.
Align ecological state-variable concepts like biodiversity and plant population balance under the same ecology-focused Class_Group.

args.new_description: Ecological processes, connections, and biotic interactions within ecosystems, excluding specific organism roles like predators which are modeled separately.
args.justification: After moving 'predators' out, refine the class name/description to focus on ecological processes and interactions while assigning it to the shared ecological Class_Group.
